Parameters: int: The position of the item which has been removed.
int: The number of items which have been removed.
onRemoved(int, int).Description: Called when count number of items are removed from the given position.

Parameters: int: The position of the item which has been updated.
int: The number of items which has changed.
onChanged(int, int, java.lang.Object).Description: Called when count number of items are updated at the given position.
onChanged(int, int, java.lang.Object).FullName: void onChanged (int position, int count, Object payload)

Parameters: int: The position of the new item.
int: The number of items that have been added.
onInserted(int, int).Description: Called when count number of items are inserted at the given position.

Parameters: int: The previous position of the item before the move.
int: The new position of the item.
onMoved(int, int).Description: Called when an item changes its position in the list.

dispatchLastEvent().Description: BatchingListUpdateCallback holds onto the last event to see if it can be merged with the next one. When stream of events finish, you should call this method to dispatch the last event.

ClassDesc: Wraps a @B_android#support#v7#util#ListUpdateCallback_E@ callback and batches operations that can be merged. For instance, when 2 add operations comes that adds 2 consecutive elements, BatchingListUpdateCallback merges them and calls the wrapped callback only once. This is a general purpose class and is also used by @B_android#support#v7#util#DiffUtil#DiffResult_E@ and @B_android#support#v7#util#SortedList_E@ to minimize the number of updates that are dispatched. If you use this class to batch updates, you must call @B_android#support#v7#util#BatchingListUpdateCallback#dispatchLastEvent_E@ when the stream of update events drain.
